video.title: Build and deploy a portfolio website [Full Tutorial Course]
video.description:
This course will teach you to build and deploy a neat portfolio for yourself. To watch the interactive version of the course, visit the original Scrimba course 👉 https://scrimba.com/g/gportfolio (code available at that link).

Why should you have a portfolio?
As a developer, you need to ways to showcase your skills to potential employers. There's no better way of doing this than a dedicated portfolio page. It gives you full control of how you'd like to present yourself.

In this course, the brilliant teacher Kevin Powell will take you through every single step of building a neat-looking portfolio website. You'll also learn to customize it to suit your personal style. Towards the end of the course, Kevin shows you how to deploy the site to DigitalOcean, so that you will end up with a live website upon completing the course!

The site is built without using any web frameworks, so the only prerequisites for this course are basic HTML and CSS skills.

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00) 1. Introduction
⌨️ (4:31) 2. Setting things up - HTML
⌨️ (9:03) 3. The Header Area - HTML
⌨️ (14:02) 4. Intro Section
⌨️ (19:56) 5. About me, Work and Footer - HTML
⌨️ (28:39) 6. Setting up the Custom Properties and General Styles
⌨️ (39:22) 7. Styling the titles and subtitles
⌨️ (43:38) 8. Setting up the intro section
⌨️ (55:57) 9. Styling the services section
⌨️ (1:08:50) 10. The About Me Section
⌨️ (1:19:52) 11. The Portfolio
⌨️ (1:28:40) 12. Adding the Social Icons with Font Awesome
⌨️ (1:31:39) 13. Styling the Footer
⌨️ (1:37:26) 14. Setting up the Navigation Styles
⌨️ (1:44:24) 15. Creating the Hamburger
⌨️ (1:51:17) 16. Adding the JS
⌨️ (2:00:29) 17. Creating the Portfolio Item Page
⌨️ (2:06:42) 18. Customizing Your Page
⌨️ (2:08:45) 19. DigitalOcean Droplets - What they are and how to set one up
⌨️ (2:19:02) 20. DigitalOcean Droplets - Uploading files via FTP

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://freecodecamp.org/news

topLevelComment.author: Kevin Powell
topLevelComment.text:
I hope that you enjoy the course and make something awesome for yourself based on it! YT likes to flag posts with links, but if you do anything cool with this, hit me up on Twitter and I'd love to see what you made!

Also, if you enjoyed this and like learning new CSS stuff, that's my jam over on my channel :)

topLevelComment.author: Anja Topić
topLevelComment.text:
Hi, great work!
Can you please explain why you use "var" for color in CSS and can I use more usual ways to determine color while following tutorial?

replies.author: Tyler Scott
replies.text:
If I understand correctly, you *can* use more usual ways to determine colour and still follow this tutorial. 
Wherever he is using "var" he is just referring back to what he already assigned in ::root at the top of his CSS file (AKA a custom property or variable).

If you want to use a more usual way, just select whatever colour you would like to use instead of using var. It is beneficial though to use CSS variables because you can change many properties all at once, instead of going through and changing properties you wish to edit, one by one.

topLevelComment.author: Kevin Rose
topLevelComment.text:
I'm pretty new to all this stuff.  I haven't looked at website design in about 20 years now.  So far, CSS seems pretty simple and easy to use. This is based on all I know which is basically, make a bunch of <div>s on your page and then you can create "standardized" styles for each on your .css file.  
I am excited to see if there are more capabilities with CSS.

topLevelComment.author: Chris Dignall
topLevelComment.text:
Hi, thanks for posting this tutorial, I have  been following it for the past few days and generally things have gone well. However, I am up to 1hr 53min 30sec, where you type ".nav-open .hamburger {transform: translateX(0)" 
For me, the menu just appears on the screen and doesn't transition from the right hand side of the screen across to the left, as it does for you in the tutorial. Could you please suggest a reason why I may be experiencing this issue? Many thanks.

replies.author: Herbert Muhiirwa
replies.text:
You will have to use javascript to do that.. write code so that when a user clicks on the hamburger, the  value of translateX(0) (menu covering whole page) will change  it's value to 100%  ie; translateX(100%) (.. menu disappears).
Tips: first understand what translateX() does by using different values like translateX(10%),
translateX(50%),
translateX(90%)
translateX(100%).
then look for how to manipulate that style with javascript.

Hello Guys, I really am in love with the Content that FreecodeCamp Guys Upload. I have learnt so much from them but something i missed a lot in this as well as many other channels was not enough tutorials based on "Creating Machine Learning Based Web Applications with Python"
I wanted more of such type of contents and i know many of you might also be interested in having more of such contents. 

So, I have also started a YouTube Channel where i started doing this only. Guys Do check out the channel and provide some valuable FEEDBACK. 
Thank You and Peace

topLevelComment.author: Tzwac dastag
topLevelComment.text:
⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (@) 1. Introduction
⌨️ (@) 2. Setting things up - HTML
⌨️ (@) 3. The Header Area - HTML
⌨️ (@) 4. Intro Section
⌨️ (@) 5. About me, Work and Footer - HTML
⌨️ (@) 6. Setting up the Custom Properties and General Styles
⌨️ (@) 7. Styling the titles and subtitles
⌨️ (@) 8. Setting up the intro section
⌨️ (@) 9. Styling the services section
⌨️ (@) 10. The About Me Section
⌨️ (@) 11. The Portfolio
⌨️ (@) 12. Adding the Social Icons with Font Awesome
⌨️ (@) 13. Styling the Footer
⌨️ (@) 14. Setting up the Navigation Styles
⌨️ (@) 15. Creating the Hamburger
⌨️ (@) 16. Adding the JS
⌨️ (@) 17. Creating the Portfolio Item Page
⌨️ (@) 18. Customizing Your Page
⌨️ (@) 19. DigitalOcean Droplets - What they are and how to set one up
⌨️ (@) 20. DigitalOcean Droplets - Uploading files via FTP

--
